Notes: In bilinguals, there was a within-subject variability whilst speaking one language or the other: speaking a gendered language, participants made gender-preserving errors in noun-naming; whilst speaking a non-gendered language they made lesser gender-preserving errors in noun-naming

In bilinguals, there were no carry-over effects of the native language onto the second language acquired, thus showing that grammatical gender does not affect their cognitive conceptual representations
